title: Dear Richard Madeley: 'I can’t get my daughter and partner to talk'
text:
Dear Richard

My partner and I have been together for six years. We Iive apart but plan to move in together next year. My daughter met him when she was 15, and she told me flat out that she didn’t like him.

At 21 she has gone away to university. Recently when she came back we were all sitting at the table having lunch. This time she sat with us instead of taking her plate to her room, which I thought was a good sign. Trouble was, my partner ignored her.

I was talking to them both but they didn’t talk to each other. It made me so uncomfortable! I tactfully brought up the subject with my partner a few days later saying I hoped that they could one day have a friendly relationship. His reaction was...
